metadata.description: 10-year investment return projections from major financial institutions for 2026
metadata.note: Projections are nominal (not inflation-adjusted) unless otherwise noted. All percentages are annualized returns.

us_equities.notes: Subdued long-term prospects due to stretched valuations. Base case: 4-5% annual returns. Bull case (AI succeeds): 8-10% (10% probability). Bear case (AI disappoints): -2% to 2% (3% probability).

global_equities_ex_us_unhedged.index: MSCI All Country World ex USA Index
global_equities_ex_us_unhedged.notes: Includes both developed and emerging markets. Vanguard expects international to outperform U.S. by roughly 1-2% annually.

global_ex_us_developed_markets_unhedged.notes: Vanguard explicitly favors non-U.S. developed markets. Expected to outperform U.S. stocks.

emerging_markets_equities_unhedged.notes: Higher return potential but with higher volatility than developed markets.

us_value.index: Lowest one-third price/book ratio of Russell 1000 Index
us_value.notes: Vanguard identifies U.S. value-oriented equities as one of strongest risk-return profiles. Estimated 0.5% premium over U.S. broad market.

us_growth.index: Highest one-third price/book ratio of Russell 1000 Index
us_growth.notes: Growth stocks typically have lower expected returns than value in current valuation environment.

us_large_cap.index: Highest one-third market cap of Russell 1000 Index
us_large_cap.notes: Similar to broad U.S. market given large-cap dominance.

us_small_cap.index: Lowest two-thirds market cap of Russell 3000 Index
us_small_cap.notes: Small-cap premium historically ~1-1.5% over large-cap. Estimated 1.1% premium over U.S. broad market.

us_reits.notes: Real estate investment trusts. Correlated with stocks but different risk profile.

us_aggregate_bonds.notes: Based on December 31, 2025 VCMM running. Yield-driven return expectations. Includes government and corporate bonds.

global_bonds_ex_us_hedged.notes: International bonds hedged to USD. Slightly lower than U.S. aggregate due to currency hedging costs.

us_treasury_bonds.notes: Broad Treasury index. Slightly below aggregate bonds due to no credit risk premium.

us_short_term_treasury_bonds.notes: Short-term Treasuries (1-5 year maturity). Lower return but lower interest rate risk than intermediate/long-term.

us_long_term_treasury_bonds.notes: Long-term Treasuries. Higher duration risk but potentially higher returns.

us_credit.notes: Investment-grade corporate bonds. Credit spread over Treasuries typically 0.5-0.8%.

us_high_yield_corporate.index: Bloomberg U.S. High Yield Corporate Bond Index
us_high_yield_corporate.notes: High-yield (junk) bonds. Higher return but with significant credit risk and volatility.

emerging_markets_sovereign.index: Bloomberg Emerging Markets USD Sovereign Bond Index – 10% Country Capped
emerging_markets_sovereign.notes: Emerging market sovereign bonds denominated in USD. Higher yield but with country/sovereign risk.

us_tips.index: Bloomberg U.S. Treasury Inflation Protected Securities Index
us_tips.notes: Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities. Real yield component (~2%) plus inflation adjustment (~2%).

us_mortgage_backed_securities.index: Bloomberg U.S. Mortgage Backed Securities Index
us_mortgage_backed_securities.notes: Mortgage-backed securities. Similar to aggregate bonds but with prepayment risk.

us_municipal_bonds.notes: Municipal bonds. Lower nominal yield but tax-free for qualified investors.

us_high_yield_municipal_bonds.index: Bloomberg Municipal Bond: High Yield Index
us_high_yield_municipal_bonds.notes: High-yield municipal bonds. Higher return than investment-grade munis but with credit risk.

us_cash.notes: Cash equivalents. Minimal risk, preserves capital. Yield follows Fed policy.

us_municipal_cash.notes: Short-term municipal securities. Tax-free cash alternative.

commodities.notes: Broad commodity index. High volatility. Useful for diversification due to negative correlation with stocks.

us_inflation.index: Consumer Price Index for all Urban Consumers (CPI-U)
us_inflation.notes: Inflation expectation. Used for real return calculations.

vcmm_notes.interactive_tool: Specific return projections for all asset classes are available in the interactive VCMM tool at the source URL
vcmm_notes.methodology: VCMM uses Monte Carlo simulation (10,000 simulations per asset class) based on statistical analysis of historical data from 1960 onward
vcmm_notes.volatility: Volatility (standard deviation) projections also available in interactive tool

recommended_allocation.notes: 2026 recommended portfolio allocation favors bonds over stocks

key_themes: AI-led economic boom potential but muted equity returns
Stretched U.S. equity valuations
Preference for international and value stocks
Fixed income offers attractive risk-return profile

us_large_cap_equities.notes: Down slightly from last year's 6% projection. Lower than previous 10-year period's 13% returns.

international_equities.notes: Forecast to outperform U.S. large-cap equities. Estimated 0.6% premium over U.S. large-cap (5.9%). Viewed as attractively valued alternatives to U.S. stocks with potential for strong returns in 2026.

emerging_markets_equities.notes: Expected to outperform U.S. large-cap equities. Estimated 1.6% premium over U.S. large-cap (5.9%) based on historical patterns.

fixed_income.notes: Expected to deliver solid returns in 2026, with most gains from coupon income rather than price appreciation. Estimated based on current yield environment. Attractive yields remain available.

key_themes: Fixed income continues to benefit from elevated rates
Equities face narrowing advantage over risk-free investments
Market imbalances persist (concentrated valuations, tight credit spreads)
Diversification opportunities in international markets and fixed income

balanced_portfolio.notes: Expected return for hypothetical balanced portfolio

key_themes: Starting yields are primary determinant of long-term bond returns
Equity and fixed-income return assumptions have converged

us_equities.notes: Estimated based on consensus of other institutions and JPMorgan's building block methodology. Detailed assumption matrices available in USD, Euro, and Sterling currencies. Full Excel/PDF matrices available on JPMorgan Asset Management website.

international_equities.notes: Estimated based on consensus that international outperforms U.S. and JPMorgan's themes favoring international diversification.

bonds.notes: Estimated based on consensus of other institutions and JPMorgan's focus on 'resilient profits and higher yields in public markets'.

key_themes: Resilient profits and higher yields in public markets
Resilient growth and warmer inflation in macroeconomic forecasts
AI advancement and economic nationalism as major forces
Balanced global portfolio positioned to benefit from evolving trends

us_equities.notes: Estimated based on BlackRock's pro-risk stance and overweight U.S. stocks on AI theme. Slightly above consensus due to AI optimism. Views this as favorable for active investing.

international_equities.notes: Estimated based on consensus and BlackRock's diversification themes.

bonds.notes: Estimated lower due to BlackRock being tactically underweight long-term U.S. Treasuries. Sees private credit and infrastructure as supportive.

key_themes: Micro is Macro: AI buildout capital spending has macroeconomic impact
Leveraging Up: AI builders front-loading investment creates leveraged financial system
Diversification Mirage: Traditional diversification may represent big active bets
Recommends nimble portfolios with clear contingency plans
Exposure to private markets and hedge funds

market_positioning.bonds: Short positions in long-dated government bonds
market_positioning.view: Current market equilibrium as fragile with signs of complacency

us_equities.notes: Estimated conservative due to Fidelity's note that 2026 gains may be more modest. 2026 could be another positive year for stocks, though gains may be more modest and concentrated. Rising earnings now primary driver after years of rising valuations.

international_equities.notes: Estimated slightly lower than consensus due to Fidelity reducing assumptions. Following 2025's strong gains, Fidelity reduced long-term return assumptions downward, particularly for international stocks.

bonds.notes: Estimated based on consensus and Fidelity's 20-year horizon focus.

key_themes: Diversification may be critical going forward
Look beyond US mega-cap tech stocks
Consider international equities, commodities, or alternative investments
Six key investing themes: AI revolution, international stocks catch-up potential, quality stocks for uncertain times
risks: Market concentration (heavy reliance on mega-cap tech stocks)

us_equities.notes: Estimated conservative due to reduced assumptions. Following 2025's strong gains, most firms reduced long-term return assumptions for equities downward. Valuations now near fair value estimates.

international_equities.notes: Estimated lower than previous forecasts but still outperforming U.S. Return projections for both developed and emerging markets have been meaningfully lowered compared to previous forecasts, though international equities still expected to outperform US stocks over next decade.

bonds.notes: Estimated close to equity returns. Equity and fixed-income return assumptions have converged significantly. Bonds offering returns only modestly lower than stocks despite significantly lower volatility.

key_observations: Equity and fixed-income return assumptions are now much closer than historically typical
Bonds offer comparable returns to stocks with much lower volatility
Conservative investors can maintain comparable returns with less risk
Market discounts concentrated in AI mega-cap stocks
Undervalued opportunities harder to find broadly
geographic_opportunities: Undervalued regions: South Africa and Asia

us_equities_range.notes: Vanguard most conservative (3.9-5.9%), BNY most optimistic (7.6%), Schwab middle (5.9%)

international_equities.notes: Most institutions favor international over U.S. equities

bonds.consensus: Attractive yields available, solid returns expected
bonds.notes: Return assumptions have converged with equities, offering lower volatility

key_consensus_points: Most firms reduced equity return assumptions downward following 2025 gains
International equities expected to outperform U.S. stocks
Bonds offer comparable returns to stocks with much lower volatility
AI theme remains important but valuations are stretched

consolidated_10_year_projections.description: Consolidated expected annual returns for next 10 years (2026-2035) based on institutional forecasts

total_us_stock.notes: Total US stock market (large-cap blend). Conservative estimate based on Vanguard median and Schwab. BNY more optimistic. Represents broad US equity market including S&P 500 and total market indices.

sources: Vanguard: Expected to outperform U.S. by 1-2%
Schwab: Expected to outperform U.S. large-cap
total_foreign_stock.notes: Total international/foreign stock market (developed + emerging markets blend). Consensus that international will outperform U.S. stocks. Estimated as weighted average of developed (6.5%) and emerging (7.5%) markets.

sources: Combination of small-cap premium (~1.5%) and value premium (~0.5%)
Historical data shows ~2% combined premium over large-cap blend
DFA and academic research on factor premiums
us_small_cap_value.notes: US small-cap value stocks. Combines small-cap premium (~1.5%) and value premium (~0.5%) over total US stock market. Higher expected return but with higher volatility.

bonds.notes: US Aggregate Bond Index (includes government and corporate bonds). Strong consensus around 4.3% based on current yield environment. Represents broad US fixed income market.

sources: Slightly below intermediate-term bonds due to lower duration
short_term_treasuries.notes: Short-term US Treasury bonds (1-5 year maturity). Lower return than intermediate/long-term bonds but with lower interest rate risk. Estimated 0.5% below aggregate bonds.

cash.notes: Cash equivalents (3-month Treasury bills, money market funds). Minimal risk, preserves capital. Yield follows Fed policy. Lowest return but highest liquidity and safety.

international_tilt_70_30.notes: 40% total US stock, 30% total foreign stock, 30% bonds

aggressive_growth_80_20.notes: 40% total US stock, 40% total foreign stock, 20% bonds

small_cap_value_tilt.notes: 30% total US stock, 30% US small-cap value, 20% total foreign stock, 20% bonds

notes: Returns are nominal (not inflation-adjusted) annualized percentages
Based on consensus of available institutional forecasts
Where specific data unavailable, estimates based on historical premiums and current market conditions
Actual returns will vary significantly from these projections
These are expected returns, not guarantees

years_4_7.alignment: Plan assumption (5.25%) is slightly optimistic vs consolidated (4.65%)

years_8_10.alignment: Plan assumption (6.0%) is slightly optimistic vs consolidated (5.5%)

years_11_30.alignment: Uses historical averages, appropriate for long-term planning

alignment_assessment.years_1_10: Well-aligned with consolidated projections. Plan assumptions slightly optimistic for years 4-10 but reasonable given international tilt
alignment_assessment.years_11_30: Uses historical 10% returns, which is above current institutional projections but appropriate for long-term planning once valuations normalize
alignment_assessment.international_bias: Consistent with all institutions' preference for international equities
alignment_assessment.bond_assumptions: 4.5% assumption aligns well with consolidated 4.3% projection
